Represents selected elements in the editor window. The argument `ed` is a
[CKEditor editor](http://docs.ckeditor.com/#!/api/CKEDITOR.editor "see official site")  instance.

Cell.description: Represents a table cell. The argument is supposed to be passed to the "content" property.

Link.name: Link
Link.description: This class is represent an html link tag "a".

List.name: List

This is a parent class for ordered and unordred lists. If argument is provided and is allowed one, it will be used
to set the property "tag". Otherwise, "tag" property will be set to the first allowed value.

ListItem.description: This class is used to represent a list item.

OList.name: OList
OList.description: This class is used to represent ordered lists.

UList.name: UList
UList.description: This class is used to represent unordered lists.

Content.name: Content
Content.description: This class is used to encompass other objects.

Dom.name: Dom
Dom.description: This class is sort of helper to deal with DOM elements.

Factory.name: Factory
Factory.description:
This class is to be used to create different objects. What type of object is to be created
is decided based on functionality of {{#crossLink "Mapping"}}Mapping{{/crossLink}} class,
an instance of which might be passed as an argument.
instance.

Mapping.name: Mapping
Mapping.description:
This class associates different types of object. It is intended to be used along with
{{#crossLink "Factory"}}Factory{{/crossLink}} class.
The idea is to have criteria on which decide what type of objects should be constructed.
This class is responsible for these criteria.

PlainText.name: PlainText
PlainText.description:
Represents plain text. This class is intented to represent [text node](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Text) elements.
Though there is no `text` tag in HTML, it is introduced here in order to consider plain text on the same basis as other tags.

Tag.name: Tag
Tag.description: This class is used to represent a general html tag.

Properties.name: Properties
Properties.description:
A general Property class. If the argument is an object, then its properties are copied
into Property instance. If the argument is a string, then it will be splitted according to
the pattern "key: value;" to populate object properties.

classitems.description: Editor instance containing the selection.
classitems.name: editor

classitems.description: Selected elements.
classitems.name: selected

classitems.description: Array of [range instances](http://docs.ckeditor.com/#!/api/CKEDITOR.dom.range) corresponding to the selection.
classitems.name: ranges

classitems.description: {{#crossLink "Selection/ranges:property"}}ranges{{/crossLink}} getter.
classitems.name: getRanges

classitems.description:
{{#crossLink "Selection/selected:property"}}selected{{/crossLink}} setter. Sets as well
{{#crossLink "Selection/ranges:property"}}ranges{{/crossLink}}.
classitems.name: setSelected

classitems.description: {{#crossLink "Selection/selected:property"}}selected{{/crossLink}} getter.
classitems.name: getSelected

classitems.description: {{#crossLink "Selection/editor:property"}}editor{{/crossLink}} getter.
classitems.name: getEditor

classitems.description:
{{#crossLink "Selection/editor:property"}}editor{{/crossLink}} setter. Sets as well
{{#crossLink "Selection/selected:property"}}selected{{/crossLink}} and
{{#crossLink "Selection/ranges:property"}}ranges{{/crossLink}}.
classitems.name: setEditor

classitems.description:
If selection is empty, returns empty array. Otherwise returns two dimensional array of the form 
[[a00, a01, ...], [a10, a11, ...], ...].
Each inner array corresponds to the elements inside the {{#crossLink "Selection/ranges:property"}}ranges{{/crossLink}} property of the selection. Since DOM is an ***ordered*** collection of the nodes, the the above mentioned array is just a collection of simply-connected sets of nodes corresponding to the selection. NB1: _Simply-connected_ set is a set such that there exists a path inside the set connecting two arbitrary elements of the set. NB2: _Path_ consists of pieces connecting two neighbours (the set is ordered, so that the concept of "neighbour" exists).
classitems.name: selectedNodes

return.description:
two dimensional array of
                                      [CKEDITOR.dom.domObject](http://docs.ckeditor.com/#!/api/CKEDITOR.dom.domObject)
                                      or empty array

classitems.description:
Two-dimensional array of nodes in selection.

This property was created in order to assure that private method
{{#crossLink "Selection/selectedNodes:method"}}selectedNodes{{/crossLink}} gets called
just once because it seemingly modifies DOM in such
a way that if one calles it multiple times, a wrong array offset is requested, hence, an
error is generated.
classitems.name: nodes

classitems.description: Returns text representation of the selected nodes. Remember that they are located inside a two-dimensional array.
classitems.name: toText

params.name: blockSeparator
params.description: string to be used as a separator between arrays

params.name: elemSeparator
params.description: string to be used as a separator between elements in array

classitems.description: Returns the start element of selection if it exists.
classitems.name: getStartElement

classitems.description:
Returns `true` if {{#crossLink "Selection/selectedNodes:method"}}selectedNodes{{/crossLink}} is empty,
`false` otherwise.

{{#crossLink "Selection/selectedNodes:method"}}selectedNodes{{/crossLink}} output is considered empty
if it is either empty array `[]` or an array containing empty array: `[[]]`.
classitems.name: isEmpty

classitems.description:
Returns `true` if selected text starts inside a link, `false` otherwise.
In case when the selection is empty, cursor position is considered as beginning
of empty selection.
classitems.name: startsInsideLink

return.description: whether the selection starts inside a link

classitems.description:
Returns `true` if selection content is editable, `false` otherwise. Selection is editable if:
  1. it is empty
  2. it contains a single element that has type `text`
  3. it contains a single element that is a link which child nodes are of type `text`
classitems.name: isEditable

classitems.description:
Removes duplicate DOM nodes form input array. Each element of the array must be an instance of
[CKEDITOR.dom.domObject](http://docs.ckeditor.com/#!/api/CKEDITOR.dom.domObject).
classitems.name: dropDuplicates

params.name: $arr
params.description:
one-dimensional array of
                                             [CKEDITOR.dom.domObject](http://docs.ckeditor.com/#!/api/CKEDITOR.dom.domObject)
                                             objects

classitems.description:
Replaces each element in {{#crossLink "Selection/selected:property"}}selected{{/crossLink}} by
a link in which this element is located. In case the element is not located inside any link, then it
is leaved without changes. The output array mimics the structure of
{{#crossLink "Selection/selected:property"}}selected{{/crossLink}} array: it should be a two-dimensional array
without duplicates.
classitems.name: absorbLink

classitems.description:
Propagate style property named `prop` with the value `val` to the last descendant of each node in the selection.
Remember that the selection is in general a two-dimensional array (or one-dimensional if the selection is empty).
classitems.name: switchDeepestChildStyle

params.name: String
params.description: prop        name of the property to be imposed

params.name: String
params.description: val         on-value of the above property

params.name: String
params.description: altVal      off-value of the property

classitems.description: Transforms a cell-html string into Cell object. It is supposed that the string to process is of the following form: ` ... `. Inside the tag, there might be other nodes. If they are recognized as a "supported" ones, the corresponding functions will be called to transform them into objects.

classitems.description:
Transforms a row-html string into a Row object. It is supposed that the string to process is of the
following form: <tr ... > ... </tr>. Inside the tag, there might be elements "td" that will be
processed one by one by function String::createCellFromHtml().

Creates an object representation from a string that is an html repersentation of a table. Only one table is supposed to be processed at a time, so the string to be processed is to be of the following form ` ...
`. Inside the tag, there should be tags "tr" that will be processed one by one by function String::createRowFromHtml().
classitems.name: createTableFromHtml

classitems.description:
Transforms a list string into a List object. The argument listType is used to initialize the property "name" of the returned instance. If it is not provided, that the node tag-name property is used. It is supposed that the string to process is of the following form: `
    ...
` or `
    ...
`. Inside the tag, there might be other nodes. If they are recognized as a "supported" ones, the corresponding functions will be called to transform them into objects.

params.description: ul or li

classitems.description:
Returns html representation of the instance if
{{#crossLink "Image/getOrigin:method"}}getOrigin(){{/crossLink}} returns non-empty string.
Otherwise, returns empty string.

Html representation consists of opening and closing tags that are output of methods
{{#crossLink "Tag/openingTag:method"}}openingTag{{/crossLink}} and
{{#crossLink "Tag/closingTag:method"}}closingTag{{/crossLink}} correspondingly.

This method overrides the parent one {{#crossLink "Tag/toHtml:method"}}toHtml{{/crossLink}}
(since I could not consistently call a parent class method from a child one when the child
class overrides the corresponding parent method.)

  1. {{#crossLink "Tag/tag:property"}}tag{{/crossLink}} to be "a"
  2. {{#crossLink "Tag/className:property"}}className{{/crossLink}} to be "Link"
  3. {{#crossLink "Tag/_properties:property"}}_properties{{/crossLink}} to be {{#crossLink "LinkProperties"}}LinkProperties{{/crossLink}}

classitems.description:
Sets `text-attribute` of the {{#crossLink "Link/style:property"}}`style`{{/crossLink}} property.
If the argument is missing or equal to `true`, "underline" is imposed.
If the argument is false, then "none" is imposed.
If the argument is a string,  `text-property` will be assigned to be equal to that string.
If nothing of the above holds, `text-property` remains unchanged.
classitems.name: underline

classitems.description: Sets `text-attribute` of the {{#crossLink "Link/style:property"}}`style`{{/crossLink}} property to be `none`.
classitems.name: dropUnderline

classitems.description:
Apply target properties on the argument `obj`. The following cases are distinguished:
  • the argument is an instance of {{#crossLink "Link"}}Link{{/crossLink}}. In this case, returns output of {{#crossLink "Link/updateLink:method"}}updateLink{{/crossLink}} method.
  • the argument is an instance of {{#crossLink "Content"}}Content{{/crossLink}}. In this case, returns output of {{#crossLink "Link/applyContent:method"}}applyContent{{/crossLink}} method.
  • the argument is an instance of {{#crossLink "Tag"}}Tag{{/crossLink}}. In this case, returns output of {{#crossLink "Link/applyTag:method"}}applyTag{{/crossLink}} method.
If non of the above holds, result of {{#crossLink "Link/wrap:method"}}wrap{{/crossLink}} method is returned.
classitems.name: apply

return.description: type of output depends on input argument

classitems.description:
Returns a copy of the target in which {{#crossLink "Tag/content:property"}}content{{/crossLink}}

classitems.name: wrap

classitems.description:
Converts the argument in link. Argument `tagObj` must be a {{#crossLink "Tag"}}Tag{{/crossLink}} instance. If its {{#crossLink "Tag/content"}}content{{/crossLink}} is
  1. non empty, then it is returned a copy of the argument in which {{#crossLink "Tag/content:property"}}content{{/crossLink}} is replaced by output of {{#crossLink "Link/applyContent:method"}}applyContent{{/crossLink}} method.
  2. empty, then a {{#crossLink "Link"}}Link{{/crossLink}} instance is returned. This instance has {{#crossLink "Tag/attributes:property"}}attributes{{/crossLink}} and {{#crossLink "Tag/styles:property"}}styles{{/crossLink}} of the target and its {{#crossLink "Tag/content:property"}}content{{/crossLink}} contains `tagObj` as the only element.
classitems.name: applyTag

classitems.description:

from the target

classitems.description:
Drops the cell at the given position and resizes the remaining cells. If the cell to drop has a nieghbour to its right, then the freed space isassigned to that neighbour, otherwise it is assigned to the left neighbour: 
|xxx| a | b   | c |   ->   |     a | b   | c |
| a |xxx| b   | c |   ->   | a |     b   | c |
| a | b | c | xxx |   ->   | a | b | c       |
If the cell to drop does not exist, the row remains unchanged.
classitems.name: knockOutCell

params.name: cellNum
params.description: cell number to delete. Numeration starts with 0.

classitems.description:
Sets `tbody` part of the table. The argument must be either a {{#crossLink "Row"}}Row{{/crossLink}}
instance or an array of {{#crossLink "Row"}}Row{{/crossLink}} instances.
Otherwise, an error is thrown.

Even though not more than one instance of `tbody` must be present among
{{#crossLink "Tag/content:property"}}content{{/crossLink}}
{{#crossLink "Content/elements:property"}}elements{{/crossLink}}, all `tbody` tags are first dropped
from {{#crossLink "Tag/content:property"}}content{{/crossLink}} and then the requested one is inserted.

classitems.description:
Imposes the widths of all cell in all rows of the table body. If the argument is not array, an error is thrown.
If the array length is different from the number of columns, an error is thrown. Otherwise, it is called
method {{#crossLink "Row/setCellWidths:method"}}setCellWidths{{/crossLink}} on each row of table body.
classitems.name: setProfile

params.name: profile
params.description: an array of cell widths that will be applied to each row.

classitems.description:
Inserts a cell "cell" into a given position "pos" of each row of the table.
If the table has 5 columns, then after insertion it will have 5+1=6 columns.
Position "pos" will correspond to the index of the inserted cell in the row after insertion.
"pos" must be a valid cell number into the table after insertion. So, for the example above,
the valid values for "pos" are 0, 1, 2, 3, 4 and 5.
classitems.name: insertColAt

classitems.description:
Removes the border of the table. It updates the properties 'attr' and 'style' of the instance:
1. in 'style' property, deletes the properties: 'border-width', 'border-color' and sets up 'border-style' to 'none'
2. in 'attr' property, deletes 'border' property.

classitems.description:
Returns true if the table is fragmented, and false otherwise. It takes table rows and calls method
{{#crossLink "Row/onlyTableInside:method"}}onlyTableInside{{/crossLink}} on each of them until
first "false" is encountered.

A table is a __framed table__ if all table rows have only one cell and this cell contains
only one element that is a Table instance.

return.description: true if the table is framed, and false otherwise

{{#crossLink "Table/phantomTable:property"}}phantomTable{{/crossLink}} is set. `False` otherwise.

is delegated to its `toHtml` method (if an element has no `toHtml` method, this element gets ignored).

Scans recursively the content of "element" property and returns true, if each item of the content is empty. Returns false otherwise. What is supposed to be empty:
  • objects having method `isEmpty()` and which returns `true`
  • '' or ' '
  • objects without any attributes
todo: decide whether consider functions to be empty or not.

Apply recursively this function to all items in `elements` property. In the case, the last
item is empty, deletes it.

  2. object without methods
  3. string ''
  4. array []

If the argument is empty, nothing is done. The argument is considered empty, if the method

classitems.description:

Each element of the input array is to be mimicked using the means of the FACTORY. If it is not
defined, then no loading is performed and `false` is returned. Otherwise, the method tries to load
and returns `true`.
classitems.name: load

params.name: arr
params.description: array of Elements or Text instances

return.description: true, if loaded successfully, false otherwise

classitems.description:
Converts each element of this instance into a node and appends it to the argument.

Takes each element of the array {{#crossLink "Content/elements:property"}}Content::elements{{/crossLink}},
converts it into a node (if the element responds to `toNode()` method, the convertion will
be performed using this method, otherwise a text node will be constructed)
and then appends this node to the argument which is supposed to be an instance of
[DOM.Node](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Node) (in fact, it is enough
that is has [appendChild()](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Node.appendChild)
method).

params.description: name of the property to look for

Toggles inline style property `prop` of node `n`. When it turns out that the property should

params.name: altVal

classitems.description:
Returns **proxy** node of `n`:
  1. if `n` is a text element without siblings, then proxy of `n` is its parent node,
  2. if `n` is a text element with siblings or is a node element, then proxy of `n` is `n` itself.
classitems.name: _proxy

params.name: n
params.description: [Node](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Node) instance

classitems.description:
Looks for a value of style property `key` of nearest ascendant of `node` in the scope of node `scope`.
If the property is found, its value is returned, otherwise,  `undefined` is returned.

Limit node `scope` is supposed to contain `node`. Otherwise, the search for the property
is performed up to the "highest" parent of `node`.

NB: ** optimize algorithm in such a way that DOM is parsed only once even when `scope` is set wrong. **
classitems.name: getInheritedStyleProp

params.name: node
params.description: [Node](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Node) instance

params.name: scope
params.description: [Node](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Node) instance

params.name: key
params.description: name of property to find among inline style of ascendants

classitems.description:
Modifies inline style properties of a {{#crossLink "Selection/_proxy:method"}}proxy{{/crossLink}} node of deepest children of node `n` in the following way:
  1. if style property `prop` of the deepest child is equal to `val`, then inline style property of its "proxy" node is set to be `altVal`.
  2. if style property `prop` of the deepest child is not equal to `val`, then inline style property of its "proxy" node is set to be `val`.
classitems.name: _deferToggleStyle

params.name: n
params.description: [Node](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Node) instance

params.name: prop
params.description: name of style property (i.e., "width" or "text-decoration")

params.name: val
params.description: value of style property (i.e., "10px" or "underline")

classitems.description: Returns the nearest node from which `node` inherits inline style property `key`. If no such node exists, returns `undefined`.
classitems.name: getMentor

params.name: key
params.description: name of inline style property

params.name: node
params.description: [Node](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Node) instance

classitems.description:
Nails inline style property `key` of `node`: applies style property on "innocent" nodes and toggles node inline property `key` between `primary` and `secondary`. If `node` has a mentor node, then:
  1. assign value of inline style property `key` of the mentor to each {{#crossLink "Dom/complementNodes:method"}}complement node{{/crossLink}} to the path `mentor - ... - node`,
  2. eliminate inline style property `key` from the mentor,
  3. call {{#crossLink "Dom/setStyleProperty:method"}}setStyleProperty{{/crossLink}} method that takes care of setting inline style property of `node` to required value.
If `node` has no mentor node, then set its inline style property `key` to be equal to `secondary`
classitems.name: nailStyleProperty

params.name: node
params.description: [Node](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Node) instance

params.name: key
params.description: name of inline style property

params.name: primary
params.description: primary value of inline style property

params.name: secondary
params.description: secondary value of inline style property

classitems.description:
Returns reference to a node with inline style property `key` being set to `value`.
If `node` is a [Node](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Node) instance,
then reference it itself is returned. Otherwise, it is returned a new
[Node](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Node) instance, which contains
a clone of `node` and which replaces `node`.
classitems.name: setStyleProperty

params.name: node
params.description: [Node](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Node) instance

params.name: key
params.description: name of inline style property to set

params.name: value

params.description: name of inline style property of `node`

classitems.description:
Drops inline style property `key` from `node` and removes inline style attribute if
it becomes empty.
Returns `true` if the initially contains inline style property `key` and `false` otherwise.
classitems.name: dropStyleProperty

params.name: node
params.description: [Node](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Node) instance

params.name: key
params.description: name of inline style attribute to drop

return.description:
`true` if successefully deleted the requested property
                                                and `false` otherwise

classitems.description:
Toggles style property `key` of element `elem` from `primary` to `secondary`.
If the element has style property `key` equal to `primary`, then it is imposed to `secondary`.
Otherwise, it is imposed to `primary`.

An element is considered to have style property imposed if either the element itself, or any of
its parents has that value imposed.

If not [Element](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Element) instance is given as the first
argument, then the method performs nothing. Note, that for text nodes this method is not applicable,
since text nodes have no attributes.
classitems.name: toggleElementStyle

params.name: elem
params.description: [Element](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Element) instance

params.name: key
params.description: name of style property to change

params.name: primary
params.description: primary value of the above style property

params.name: secondary
params.description: secondary value of the style property

classitems.description:
Returns an [Element](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Element) instance with the style
property `key` equal to `secondary` if value of `key` attribute in "style" property  is equal to `primary`. Otherwise,

classitems.description:
Returns a one-dimensional array of [Node](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Node) instances
that are descendants of `startNode-...-endNode` path but do not belong to that path.
If path from `startNode` to `endNode` does not exist, an error is thrown.
<dl>
<dt> Path A - ... - B</dt>
<dd> An ordered collection of nodes n<sub>i</sub> from which one needs to pass through in order
to arrive to node B starting from node A passing always from a node to its child.
</dd>
<dt> Descendant of a path A - ... - B</dt>
<dd>
	A node C is a descendant of A - ... - B path if parent of node C belongs to A - ... - B path.
</dd>
</dl>

clone attribute. Otherwise, assign target attribute value to the clone attribute (there might be
a potential problem with what is passed by reference and not by values, i.e. array). But among
{{#crossLink "Tag"}}Tag{{/crossLink}} properties there are no array-valued ones.

  3. {{#crossLink "Tag/content:property"}}content{{/crossLink}} by calling {{#crossLink "Content/load:method"}}Content::load(){{/crossLink}} method.
from the argument which must be an instance of [Element](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Element) class. Returns `true` if the argument is of required type and the above mentioned `load` methods return `true`. Otherwise, `false` is returned.
NB: DOM.Element.attributes has the form `{1: {tag: "width", value:"100", ...}, 2: {tag: "color", value:"black", ...}, ...}`

classitems.description:
Check whether two different CKEDITOR.dom.node's "overlaps". Returns true, if:
  1. both `elem1` and `elem2` are of `CKEDITOR.dom.element` type and either `elem1` contains `elem2` or viceverse,
  2. only one of `elem1`, `elem2` is of `CKEDITOR.dom.element` and it contains other,
  3. both `elem1` and `elem2` are of `CKEDITOR.dom.text` and they are equal.
Otherwise, false is returned.

classitems.description:
Splits array element at position "pos" in two parts in such a way that the trace of the original array
is equal to the trace of the output array. If it is the first element of the array to be splitted, then
it is splitted in 1/2 and 1/2 (up to the truncation). If the element has a left neighbour, then the neighbour
and the element are taken off 1/3 and these two parts are given to the newly created element that is inserted
between the neighbour and the element: [a, b, ...] -> [2/3 a, 1/3 (a + b), 2/3 b, ...]
classitems.name: crack

be present as a content of the elements. The second argument `seed` serves as a hint to create the id:
if the hint string is available as id, it will be returned. Otherwise, a random symbol from 0-9, a-z
will be appended to the hint string until it becomes a valid id.

If it is set to 0, then string representation has the following form

If it is set to 1, then string representation has the following form

classitems.description:
Switches property `propName` between `val` and `altVal` in the following way:
  1. if the instance has property `propName` equal to `val`, then the method imposes its value to be `altVal` (if `altVal` is not defined, then the key `propName` gets dropped).
  2. if the instance contains property `propName` equal to `altVal`, then the method sets its value to be `val`.
  3. if the instance does not have property `propName`, then the method imposes it to be `val`.
classitems.name: toggleProperty

params.name: propName
params.description: property key to toggle (i.e., "width", "position")

params.name: val
params.description: value of property key (i.e., "25em", "fixed")

params.name: altVal
params.description:
alternative value of property key (i.e. null, "0em").
                                               This parameter is optional.

                                                         If this parameter is not an array, then it is ignored.

Splits the argument in key-value pieces as it is performed in
{{#crossLink "Properties/appendPropertyAsStringOrObj:method"}}appendPropertyAsStringOrObj(){{/crossLink}}.
If the `key` is not present in the {{#crossLink "Properties/core:property"}}core{{/crossLink}}, it is initialized
with `value`. Otherwise, it is ignored.

Returns `true` if they are equal, `false` otherwise.

classitems.description:
Clones the target. Parses all attributes of the target. If the attribute responds to "clone"
method, then assign the result of this method to the corresponding clone attribute. Otherwise,
assign the attribute value to the clone attribute (potentially problematic for what is passed
by reference and not by value, like arrays).
{{#crossLink "Properties/core:property"}}Core{{/crossLink}} is a private variable, so in the
clone it is populated by means of {{#crossLink "Properties/getProperty:method"}}getProperty(){{/crossLink}}
and {{#crossLink "Properties/setProperty:method"}}setProperty(){{/crossLink}} method.
classitems.name: clone

classitems.description:
Returns `true` if {{#crossLink "Properties/core:property"}}core{{/crossLink}} has no keys,
otherwise - `false`.
classitems.name: isEmpty

classitems.description:
String representation of the instance. If {{#crossLink "Properties/_mode:property"}}_mode{{/crossLink}} is set to 0, the representation of the following type is produced:
width="20" title="read me!"
If {{#crossLink "Properties/_mode:property"}}_mode{{/crossLink}} is set to 1, the representation of the following type is produced:
width: 50px; color: red
It parses all {{#crossLink "Properties/core:property"}}core{{/crossLink}} keys and if
  1. corresponding value responds to a `toString()` method
  2. corresponding value is a number and {{#crossLink "Properties/_mode:property"}}_mode{{/crossLink}} is 1, then 'px' is appended (**resolve this explicit dependency on unit of measurement!**)
  3. corresponding value is a string
then uses it for further substitution. Otherwise, the value is ignored. Further, if the corresponding string representation of the value turns out to be empty or undefined, the whole key-value pair is ignored.
classitems.name: toString

Nevertheless, it is sufficient that `attr` be a collection of objects with `name` and `value` properties.

available width = (element width) - (element left border width) -
		(element right border width) - (element left margin) - (element right margin)
The element width is supposed to be greater than zero and hence to have a unit of measurement (e.g. 'px'). If not set, widths of other attributes are equal to zero without unit of measurement. In this case one has to set the unit of measurement equal to the element width.
classitems.name: parentWidth

return.description:
available width for the children as Unit object
                                 (with properties "value" and "measure")
